case_vignette: A 62-year-old African American man presents to establish care and to undergo skin examination, which he reports receiving regularly since his sister was diagnosed with melanoma. Examination reveals 3-mm hyperpigmented horizontal bands across the nailbeds of all fingernails, which he reports have been present since his 20s. He denies experiencing any other nail changes or pain. He takes no medications, and he has no history of skin cancer or suspicious moles. He has no relevant medical history.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm not really facing any symptoms; I'm just here for a regular skin checkup since my sister had skin cancer.
Do you have a family history of skin cancer apart from your sister?
No, just my sister had skin cancer.
Have you had any history of significant sun exposure or sunburns in the past?
I have no relevant medical history to report in that regard.
Got it. Have you noticed any changes in the appearance of your moles or any new moles appearing?
No, I haven't had any changes or new moles appearing.
I see. Have you noticed any unusual growths or sores on your skin that have not healed?
No, I haven't noticed any unusual growths or sores that haven't healed.
Have you noticed any changes in the color, size or texture of any skin lesions?
No, I haven't experienced any changes in color, size, or texture of any skin lesions.

Thank you for your responses. Based on your family history of skin cancer and the absence of any concerning symptoms, it sounds like you are being proactive in seeking regular skin checkups, which is great. Keep it up!

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I don't have any symptoms; I'm just here for a regular skin check-up and to have someone look at the dark stripes on my fingernails that I've had since my 20s.
How long have you had these dark stripes on your fingernails?
I've had the dark stripes on my fingernails since my 20s.
Do you have any personal or family history of skin cancer?
My sister was diagnosed with melanoma, but I have no history of skin cancer myself.
Have you noticed any changes in the size, shape, or color of the dark stripes on your fingernails?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in the dark stripes on my fingernails.
Do you have any other medical problems or take any medications?
No, I don't have any other medical problems and I don't take any medications.
**Final Diagnosis:** Longitudinal Melanonychia
